name: Major Ian Thomas
description:
Major Ian Thomas (1914 – 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Major Ian Thomas in mp3 format. Evangelical writer, theological teacher and founder of the Torchbearers bible schools. These schools are now world-wide in many countries and provide a teaching base on the person of Christ in the believer and basic Biblical exposition of Bible books.

Among the many books that he wrote, the most influential have been: "The Saving Life Of Christ" , "The mystery of godliness" and "If I perish, I Perish." His burden in ministry was to express and show the indwelling life of Christ in believers and the rest and power that life will have in us as we trust and have faith.

audio_sermons.title: A Grain of Wheat
audio_sermons.description: Where in the life of Christ was one hour of more significance than another? Throughout the New Testament we read of occasions when Jesus' enemies tried to kill him, but were prevented because "His hour had not yet come." What is this "hour" of which the Scriptures speak? Major Ian Thomas says, "It is the hour without which the Lord Jesus would have been born to live in vain." He uses John 12:24, in several translations, to describe the hour on which our salvation rests.

audio_sermons.title: Are You Well
audio_sermons.description: In 3 John 1-2, the Apostle John greets Gaius "whom I love in truth." He continues: "I wish above all that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth." Is your body as healthy as  your soul? Major Thomas explains that human beings are composed of two basic parts -- that which can be seen (the  body) and that which cannot be seen (the spirit and soul). That part no one sees constitutes the real you and the actions of the body often mirrors our true spiritual health.

audio_sermons.title: Available to God
audio_sermons.description: Major Thomas speaks on making ourselves as the members of Christ's body "restfully available" to Him. He points out the necessity of relying on the Head for all functions that relate to carrying out His will. "The secret of fruitfulness is not your cleverness. . . [it] is availabilty." This is a good message about trusting in God to take care of results. We follow Him, He works through us.

audio_sermons.title: Man as You Are
audio_sermons.description: Where many Christians are utterly content to only embrace the forgiveness of God, there remains a severe ignorance of God’s full intent through the power of Christ.  Before one becomes a partaker of the divine nature, Major Thomas expounds what man in fact is.  We discover he is a living soul wrapped in flesh, needing the Spirit of God to breathe life into his Spirit.  Once the man is forgiven his goal must become, through grace, to allow and yield the Spirit’s infiltration into jis soul and flesh that he may become an instrument of righteousness.
